educations.schoolName: The George Washington University Law School

headline: Privacy and CRCL Officer at National Vetting Center

positions.description: Senior executive overseeing privacy, data governance, open records, and records management at second largest federal criminal investigative agency.  Resolve highly complex privacy issues related to the collection and use of information in support of law enforcement efforts; establishing the agency's first formal data governance process; and overseeing the modernization of the organization's electronic records management program.
positions.title: Assistant Director for Information Governance & Privacy

positions.description: Created the agency's first Privacy Office at ICE in 2008.  In 2011, assumed responsibility for the records management function, including compliance with the Federal Records Act and oversight of the management of Alien Files.
positions.title: Assistant Director for Privacy and Records (Privacy Officer)

positions.description: Served as the first Privacy and Civil Liberties Officer at the U.S. Terrorist Screening Center.  Performed the first privacy impact assessment for the TSC and established the US Government's redress process for the terrorist watch list.  Led interagency efforts to establish the 2007 Memorandum of Understanding on Terrorist Watchlist Redress Procedures.  As Special Assistant to the Director, also established an internal governance process for the TSC to streamline decision-making and the prioritization of key projects.
positions.title: Privacy and Civil Liberties Officer
Assistant Chief Counsel for Information Law
